headline: Four years after invading Ukraine, Russia sinks deeper into authoritarianism and repression
description: Since 2022, Vladimir Putin's regime has hardened relentlessly. The war has gone hand in hand with increasingly harsh control over society, all against a backdrop of mounting economic difficulties.

headline: Louvre museum president resigns
UK government says it will release files on ex-prince Andrew
Four years of war in Ukraine: Odesa's complex 'derussification'
description: The southern Ukrainian city, long under the influence of Russia and then the Soviet Union due to its access to the Black Sea, is continuing the process of dismantling the pro-Russian narrative and reclaiming the city, much to the chagrin of those who wish to preserve its Russian 'cultural heritage.'

headline: The political stakes of organized crime in Israel
description: The wave of criminal violence targeting Israel's Arab minority puts Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government squarely on the spot, argues historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

headline: London Fashion Week: A season of reinvention
description: From Burberry's urban glamour to Simone Rocha's sportswear revival, fashion houses have revamped their appeal for the fall/winter 2026-2027 collections, presented from February 19 to 23 in the British capital.

headline: Who will replace Mexican druglord 'El Mencho'?
description: After the army killed on Sunday the leader of Mexico's most powerful cartel, David Mora, a researcher at the International Crisis Group, expresses concern about the violence that could result from divisions within the criminal group and from the ambitions of rival cartels.

headline: US ambassador Kushner promises not to 'interfere' in French affairs
Putin's war against Ukraine is 'triple failure for Russia,' says Macron
EU plunged into uncertainty over US trade deal
EU chief vows to deliver €90 billion Ukraine loan
Mexico deploys 10,000 troops to restore order after violence linked to the death of drug lord 'El Mencho'
Paris municipal elections: Far-right candidate Knafo's platform is full of dubious calculations
Giorgia Meloni's strong poll numbers, a deceptive success
PSG star Achraf Hakimi faces trial for rape
Trump's threat of sending American hospital ship to Greenland revives tension
China's retired rural workers are finding rest impossible
More than 200 inmates launch hunger strike to seek benefits under Venezuela's new amnesty law
2030 Alps Games: Around 40 projects remain to be completed as the deadline nears and timelines tighten
With expected US retreat, Germany seeks to strengthen its role within NATO
description: Berlin has invested hundreds of billions of euros to rearm since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in 2022 and aims to play a major role within the North Atlantic Alliance, particularly as the US moves toward isolation.

headline: The 'impossible' task of counting deaths at sea
description: The International Organization for Migration and migrant aid NGOs simultaneously record deaths at sea in the Mediterranean and Atlantic, but often come up with very different figures. Why?

headline: Dark Bank: American suspected of leading an international criminal organization extradited to France
description: Huzefa Hafiz Ismail arrived on French soil on Friday. He was arrested in August 2024 in Texas at the request of French judicial authorities, who suspect him of leading a vast money laundering network.

headline: Trump and Iran: Threats and unanswered questions
Jean Pisani-Ferry: 'German commitment to rearmament is good news and a challenge for Europe'
'Lawless zones around Israel are the result of the Pax Judaica made possible by uncontested military hegemony'
